name: Joyce Teo
subject: Visit to BioHiTech Global at NY
message:
Hi,

We are from Jurong Town Corporation, a Statutory Board under the Singapore Government. We manage mostly industrial estates, and own 80% of Singapore's industrial land and manage many industrial properties.

We are keen in your digester technology. Two representatives from my company are making a trip to New York around 19 May 2017, and we were wondering if we could make a trip down to your company to view the technology and understand more about it. It will be a good opportunity to understand this technology, and in future possibly collaborate in implementing this technology in our estates.

Please let me know if this visit to your company is convenient. Looking forward to your reply. Thank you.

name: Kathy Cusumano
subject: Presenter Invitation - National Investment Banking Association - June 26-27, 2017 - New York, NY
message:
I  hope you will consider presenting your company at the upcoming National Investment Banking Association conference taking place in New York City on June 26-27, 2017.  The conference will be hosted at the Westin Grand Central New York Hotel located at 212 East 42nd Street, New York, NY. The cost to present is $3500.  

The National Investment Banking Association (NIBA) was formed in 1982 as a non-profit association specifically geared for the micro and small cap investment community.

Since its inception, NIBA, has proudly served as a “must attend conference” to the 8,800+ member base who together, represent over $78 billion in assets and are comprised of established and FINRA recognized broker dealers firms, investment bankers, fund managers and capital market service providers who as a membership body has successfully completed over $12 billion in new capital formation for emerging growth companies who have presented to our association to date.

Whether your company is seeking start-up/growth capital or looking to bring exposure to your company, the National Investment Banking Association's New York  conference is right for you!

NIBA’s conferences provide:
•             A unique platform and showcase for both private and public companies to present their individual stories to prospective investors, financing partners, market makers and market professionals, all experienced within the micro-small capital markets.
•             A forum which is specifically designed to capitalize upon expended time for management of presenting companies by providing an abbreviated initial 10 minute overview presentation to our conference attendees which is also live filmed, providing access to members not in attendance and an additional marketing opportunity for companies by posting to their company websites.
•             Scheduled 1-1 member meetings which provides presenting companies an opportunity to fully engage potential investors with full presentations and affords time for both in depth question and answers.

NIBA, utilizing this format in combination with hosted breakfasts, lunches and cocktail parties throughout the conference affords members and presenting companies alike, a unique experience which promotes the formation of long lasting and essential business relationships. 

To learn more about the event, please visit www.nibanet.org.  Please contact me with any questions or to ask for registration information.

name: Henry Chan
subject: Bio Digester Enquiries
message:
Dear BioHitech,
 
Our client (University District) is looking for bio digester solution for the cafeteria areas. Kindly provide us the information below so that we can further propose to our client:
•         Ball park costing of the system (Eco-safe 4, 8, 12), including supply, delivery, and install.
•         Lead time for the system to be installed
•         Besides grey water, is there any bi-product that can is beneficial for client (Biogas for energy regeneration, fertilizer etc.)
•         Space (outdoor or indoor) required 
•         Will there be any Mechanical and Electrical provision required? (beside Electrical Power Supply)
•         What will be the scheduled maintenance required, and what will be the approximate costing for the maintenance.
•         What will be the typical lifespan of the system
•         Will there be any Health and Safety Concern (Flammable, toxic gas etc.)
 
Looking forward for your favorable reply.
 
Thank you.
 
Best Regards,
Henry Chan

We will express art in many of it's forms including culinary, visual, nano brewing, farming, street art, music. We'll have a nano brewery, beer hall, beer garden, courtyard, and event space/art gallery. Our rooftop will contain a fully functioning urban farm growing herbs and veggies for the chef and farmers markets, wildflower field and an apiary for fresh local honey.  The theme is revitalization and renewal, sustainability and creativity. I have been searching for a sustainable organic waste solution.  I am still getting all my approvals lined up, site plan approval is scheduled for Aug 12 th.  Can you tell me if your solution is economically feasible for a small restaurant concept like mine??? message:
Hi!  My name is Barbara Martin.  I'm an independent business owner who lives in Nyack.  The business that I'm building is based on creating relationships with customers - individuals, non-profit associations and for-profit organizations - through healthy, all-natural, all-green products.  The opportunities for potential customers range from trying (and loving) the products to offering them to employees and the community via your website as a sustainable means of fundraising or charitable giving.  The products include the highest grade of all-natural vitamins , nutritional supplements for weight management and sports performance, REAL, SAFE green cleaning and laundry products (don't believe the labels you see in the grocery stores), and personal care items (skin and hair).  Over 50 years of health and wellness is the foundation of these products from Shaklee.  I invite you to take a look for yourself at:

http://whatsimportantnow.myshaklee.com

name: Vanessa Jalog
subject: Need a video?
message:
Hi,

My name is Vanessa. I'm wondering if you need a new video for your website or for YouTube?

If you are located in Allendale, you can get a pretty good deal on producing a marketing video right now.
http://marketingvideostv.com/Examples-and-Pricing

Professionally produced videos have been proven to boost website traffic, leads and conversions.

You can get access to some of my best video examples here:
>>http://marketingvideostv.com/Examples-and-Pricing


Thanks,
Vanessa

PS. If you are going to produce a video, I highly recommend using animation, or even a combination of photos, footage and animation. Animation is less expensive than shooting new footage with a camera and it can be used to make your story interesting and hold the attention of your prospects.
>>http://marketingvideostv.com/Examples-and-Pricing

name: Fred Rheaume
subject: Test Opportunity
message:
Good afternoon.  As I'm sure you are aware, MA is facing a Food Waste Law come Oct 1.  Dunkin Brands (corp) is trying to identify as many solutions as possible for our franchisee's that will comply with this law.  We are looking to test this technology in one of our stores for about a month.  Would you be interested in this type of a test?  We already have clearance from the town that will allow us to do this testing.

Please let me know if this is something you would like to discuss.

Thanks!
Fred

name: Tom Whytsell
subject: Company Contact
message:
Good afternoon,

My name is Tom Whytsell and I am the Business Development Manager for Confluent Translations.  We are a full service translation and localization firm offering unparalleled quality and service.  I realize you are likely contacted daily by vendors but I simply wanted to reach out to let you know who we are and what sets us apart from our competitors in an effort to determine if it makes sense for us to partner.  

Could you please provide the contact information for the individual or department that handles your current translation vendor?  If you are not sure, anyone that handles International Communication, Human Resources, or Product Development would at least point me in the right direction.

Thank you in advance for your help and I hope you have a great day!


Best Regards,


Tom Whytsell

name: Bernardo Jaxson
subject: Marketing suggestion for your website
message: Want more clients and customers? We will help them find you by putting you on the 1st page of Google. Email us back to get a full proposal.

name: Eric Scheumann
subject: Food Digester
message:
I'm interested in piloting a food digester at one of our shopping centers (food court area) and wanted to get some basic information from you.  Can you e-mail me any analytical data that you've tested on the effluent?  If heard that some WWTP have prohibitied the use of aerobic digesters that discharge gray water because of the BOD levels.  Do you have anything to the contrary?  Have any of your clients discussed with their local WWTP for review / approval?  

If you have some general specs & terms sheet that you can send along, I would appreciate it.

Thanks,
Eric

name: Laura Vargas
subject: Quotation
message:
To Whom It May Concern:



I am currently advising a waste management project for an oil facility located in Puerto Gaitan, a town in the Meta region (Southeastern area) of Colombia approximately 224.2 km (139.3 miles) from Bogota.



My Client is interested in purchasing a Food Waste Technology, to approximately 9 ton per day.

I should be grateful for general information about:

The processes you have to treat that kind of wastes. 

How works each process.

Products obtained in each process.

A quotation for 3 ton per day and 9 ton per day of each process offered.



If you need some additional information please let me know. 



I am looking forward for your valuable reply as soon as possible.



Yours faithfully,



Laura Vargas

Engineering Consultant

name: Heath Nicholas
subject: Bio Digester for 72 Grocery Stores
message:
Hello:

I am currently working with a client who owns a chain of over 72 grocery stores in a 3 state area. One of the many areas we are assessing in which they can reduce their carbon footprint besides LED lightbulbs and traditional recycling is by diverting their organic waste. We have already gone through an assessment process, and know the volume of organic waste being produced, and are now in the evaluation process of a solution. We are not looking for a consultation at this point, but only general pricing. The following shows monthly averages of different volume stores's organic waste on a monthly basis. 

14 Stores: 9 Tons/Month
36 Stores: 6 Tons/Month
22 Stores: 2 Tons/Month

Based on this information, it appears to me that your smallest model, the Eco-Safe 4 would handle the volume of the smallest to the largest of our stores. Can you give me general pricing on how much this machine costs to purchase, shipping, installation, and how much does it cost to operate on a monthly basis with Electricity, Water, and any supplies necessary for the digestion process. I know pricing will not be exact, but based on national averages.

Again, I'm only looking for general pricing at this point, and if it appears that this is a feasible solution, we will be in contact to schedule an actual evaluation and assessment.

Sincerely,

Heath Nicholas
Environmental Consultant

name: James Rees
subject: Email for Frank E. Celli
message:
Hi Frank, 

Apologies for not emailing you directly, I miss placed your business card in my travels. 

We met at the Credit Suisse PIC in London last week.   I used to work for Credit Suisse, but I am now independently consulting to a few private companies, including NNP and Hydrus Technology (both companies were at the PIC). 

At the event we briefly discussed your plans to expand into the Australian market and you mentioned you were in talks with a company already.   I am currently on the Advisory Board for one of the largest industrial product distributors focused on mining service companies.  There could be a good fit with your product and their distribution platform in Australia. 

I would like to further discuss this.  Please let me know when we could discuss. 

Regards, 
James 
+61-449-235-449

name: Eduardo Mattos
subject: Biogas output
message:
Dear,

I would like to know more detailed information about the biogas output, considering food waste inputs basicaly from supermarket discharged vegetables.
Can I have the estimated amount of biogas generated? How this gas is estored? 

Tks in advance,

Eduardo

name: christophe griffith

name: Pissed off commuter
subject: Your driver is giving you bad representation
message:
As an employee (i'm assuming) driving a vehicle with your company logo and site on it, I would think one would have some respect for other vehicles on the road. During my commute today (although today is not the first incident), for 20 minutes on the NYS Thruway north and then another 15 minutes on NY 17 west between 5:50pm and 6:35pm, a driver in a silver BioHitech labeled Nissan Cube made the road more treacherous than it needs to be.

Weaving between lanes / cutting people off (with inches between catastrophe and safety)
Tailgating (seriously couldn't tell where one car began and the other ended)
Speeding up the right lane trying to sneak in (just to get a car or two ahead)

When they got off the Chester exit I'll admit I was relieved to not have to deal with it anymore. I get that this type of behavior is a common occurrence, but your driver is representing your company as a whole. This event did lead me to your site and I've found that I actually admire what you're doing. If I was in the market for an Eco-Safe Digester however, I would think twice about contacting you after seeing how much respect your employee(s) have for the safety of human beings.

subject: BioHitech for Europe
message:
Dear Sirs/Madam,

I have been informed about your technology by the web and would be 
interested to know if the technology is already proven and ready to be 
marketed. 

Also I would be interested to receive the list of countries outside Us in 
which you would be interested to operate.

I represent an european economic association AISVEC, aiming at
promoting the development of private companies and public authorities
along Europe; it works with more then 3000 municipalities and 2000 
companies for consulting in new innovative technologies in the energy 
and environment field. We work with city councils, supermaket chains, 
hotel chains and food companies as the best customers for this technology.

We are currently working along Europe with an asian technology that is your competitor but we are opened to introduce other players in this field.

From a technical point of view I would know if you have planned the use of
a water purification system to transfer the grey water into clean water; for
example MBR technology; in this sense we are working with a research
center in italy that has patented a purification system able to replace MBR and
cut the cost of 30%.

In case we are available to discuss with you a possible use of your
technology in a municipality of Italy acting as test useful to
demonstrate its features.

Thank you for a kind reply and for any information you might have
regarding your technology.

I look forward to talk with you soon.

Best Regards

Alessio Montanarini
Vice President

AISVEC
Associazione Italiana per lo Sviluppo Economico

via Cà Lin 98
30174 Venice (Italy)

Ph. +39.392.4136128

alessio.montanarini@aisvec.eu

name: Rebecca McCarthy
subject: Product Inquiry for Eco-Safe Digester 4, 8, and 12
message:
To whom it may concern at BioHitech America :
 
Arizona State University Recycling Program is conducting research on composters to be implemented on campus to assist with our Zero Waste Initiative.  The Eco-Safe 4, Eco-Safe 8, and Eco-Safe 12 are a few of the products we are focusing on for possible implementation on our four campuses. After initial stages of research, we wanted to verify our findings or correct any misnomers.
 
Through your website and informational sheets, the following information is what I have found. (Note: We measure our food waste in metric tons not pounds so we have converted the capacity measurements given from pounds to tons.)
 
 
Product Name: Eco-Safe 4
Location Manufactured: NY, US?
Capacity (in tons): 0.4
Rate of production: 24 hours for full capacity load
Direct Output: Effluent Water, Sewer Safe
Power Required: 208 Volt, 3 Phase
Cost of One Unit: Not Specified Online?
Space Requirement (LWH): 43" x 36" x 48"

Product Name: Eco-Safe 8
Location Manufactured: NY, US?
Capacity (in tons): 0.75
Rate of production: 24 hours for full capacity load
Direct Output: Effluent Water, Sewer Safe
Power Required: 208 Volt, 3 Phase
Cost of One Unit: Not Specified Online?
Space Requirement (LWH): 57" x 44" x 52"

Product Name: Eco-Safe 12
Location Manufactured: NY, US?
Capacity (in tons): 1.25
Rate of production: 24 hours for full capacity load
Direct Output: Effluent Water, Sewer Safe
Power Required: 208 Volt, 3 Phase
Cost of One Unit: Not Specified Online?
Space Requirement (LWH): 67" x 44" x 52"
 
Special Materials Allowed (other than general food organics/green waste):
Plastics: no
Cardboard: no
Paper: no
Waxy Items: no
Meat: yes
Dairy: yes
Bone: small bones?
 
If you could please confirm that this information is correct or if there are inaccuracies, we would appreciate your help. Hope to hear from you soon and thank you in advance for your time.

Rebecca McCarthy
Arizona State University - B.S. Sustainable Ecosystems
Arizona State University Recycling Program Assistant

name: Marc Printz
subject: School Application
message:
BioHiTech,

I'm Marc Printz, a high school senior at Innovation Academy Charter School in Massachusetts. It has been three years now that I have been attempting to have my school begin composting and start a garden; it seems like this year that I may actually succeed. I have done much research into different digesters on the market and am very impressed by the ones you offer (especially the cloud aspect). I plan on recommending you in my report to my school. That said, I hope you don't mind me asking a few questions.
1. Can the grey water produced be used to water plants? It seemed that the digester produced by PowerKnot could.
2. Can the machine handle bioplastic or paper utensils (forks, knives, plates, cups) or paper napkins?
3. About how much would the Eco-Safe4 cost?
4. How full does this system need to be at any given time? This would be for a High School and Middle School of 800 kids. Using outside numbers I estimate we produce 600 pounds of food waste a day (not including bioplastics), 5 days a week. This will increase when we install a garden.

Thank you,
Marc Printz

name: Owen Yeo
subject: Distributorship in Singapore
message:
Dear Sir,

I am the Business Development Manager of Flexi Systems (Singapore) Pte Ltd, we are interested in bringing a state-of-the-art food waste digestor to our region. 

We have been around for 10 years and primarily deals with on-site silty water treatment systems. We belong to a group of 4 companies with the main company being established since 1984, and specializing in elevated work platforms. As a whole we are present in Singapore, Malaysia (Johor Bahru, Kuala Lumpur), and Indonesia (Jakarta and Surabaya). In Singapore alone we have 4 factories with a total workspace of approximately 100,000 square feet and a headcount of around 180.

The group has recently diversified into the clean/green tech industry with the incorporation of Enerprof Pte Ltd. It was incorporated in 2013 but only became active in August 2014. I am in charge of this division.

We believe that there is a market for food waste decomposition machines in Singapore. Our National Environment Agency has also started a push to promote its usage. However it seems that most such machines are simply different variations of the same thing, with minimal difference in functionality.

That is until I came across BioHiTech and your cloud based big data system. We feel that this is possibly a very strong selling point for the potential clients here in Singapore.

Is BioHitech America open to further discussions regarding a possible partnership? I assure you that we will put our utmost best towards the promotion of Eco-Safe should discussions bear fruit. Similarly, we can possibly also add extra value to possible clients by integrating a water treatment system to the effluent such that there is greater scope of usage for the water.

Do feel free to get back to me with any queries and I am looking forward to your reply.

Regards,

Owen Yeo

subject: RFQ
message:
Please quote us on following: 

Eco-Safe 1200 Digester High Volume Organic Waste Decomposition System. The ECO-Safe 1200 Digester will safely and quickly decompose virtually all organic food waste including: meat, poultry, fish, fruit, vegetables, rice, pasta, bread, coffee grinds, eggshells, and dairy products. A highly refined formula of microorganisms is used to breakdown organic waste into a liquid which can be safely disposed down the drain, completely eliminating the waste, and ultimately allowing the effluent to return to our ecosystem as water.

name: Peter Oykhman
subject: Potential project in Kazakhstan
message:
Dear Sir or Madam,

we have a potential opportunity in one of the former CIS countries for alternative Municipal Solid Waste Management technologies.  We will be happy to tell you more about this opportunity after we will sign a mutual NDA. We are in a process right now of trying to find a right partner to work on this opportunity. Could you please answer the questions below so it would be easier of us to properly evaluate potential partners. 

1. What is the main advantage of your Technology comparing to other technolies available on the market?
2. Does your technology allows to work with unsorted municipal solid waste vs traditional “Black bin"? 
3. What marketable post processing/byproducts will be available using your technology including electric energy and in what quantity per ton of solid waste? 
4. How do you qualify your technology from listed below
Thermal Technologies
Advanced Thermal Recycling 
Pyrolysis
Pyrolysis/Gasification 
Pyrolysis/Steam 
Reforming 
Conventional Gasification-Fluid Bed 
Conventional Gasification-Fixed Bed 
Plasma Arc Gasification
Biological/Chemical Technologies

Anaerobic Digestion
Aerobic Digestion/Composting 
Ethanol Fermentation 
Syngas-to-Ethanol
Biodiesel
Thermal Depolymerization 
Catalytic Cracking

Physical Technologies

Refuse-Derived Fuel (RDF) 
Densification/Pelletization 

5. What is a standard/expected annual throughput? 
6. Number of implemented projects and locations?
7. Evaluated Economics. What is your 
Capital Costs ($/ton)
Annual Operations & Maintenance cost ($)
Electricity Revenues ($) 
Recoverable Revenues ($)
Total Revenues ($)
Worst Case Break Even Tipping Fee ($/ton)

name: Sara Bell
message:
Hi!
 
It’s safe to say that the green movement has swept the nation in recent years. Most of us learned about the importance of recycling (1) in our elementary school days. As adults, many people are taking extra steps, like making home modifications (2) that help reduce our impact on the environment and cut down our monthly bills.

After a little exploring on the Internet, I realized there are so many more things we can all do every day to treat our planet well. I felt so inspired – and frankly, maybe a little guilty! – by all of the information I came across that I decided to put together a list of some daily activities we can tweak in order to take better care of Mother Earth. I thought your audience (perhaps here:http://www.biohitech.com/blog?) would also find this information interesting, so please feel free to pass these resources on. Additionally, I would love to put together a research-based article for your viewers, if you’re interested – no charge, as this is a true passion project!
 
What’s My Carbon Footprint?
http://www.nature.org/greenliving/carboncalculator/ 
Have you ever wondered how your lifestyle impacts the environment? The Nature Conservancy’s carbon footprint calculator will give you all the details.
 
Green Cleaning: Do-It-Yourself Safe Cleaning Solutions
http://www.keene.edu/sustain/greenclean.pdf 
This printable guide has lots of recipes for eco-friendly household cleaning solutions.

10 Ways to Make Your Garden More Green
http://www.treehugger.com/htgg/how-to-go-green-gardening.html 
Using these environmentally-friendly gardening tips will make your garden greener – in every sense of the word.
 
Green Pools: Operate an Eco-Friendly Pool
http://blog.intheswim.com/green-pools-operate-an-eco-friendly-pool/ 
Learn the easy - and important - steps you can take to make your pool more energy efficient.

10 Ideas: It’s Easy Being Green
http://www.familylife.com/articles/topics/life-issues/challenges/cultural-issues/10-ideas-its-easy-being-green 
This list has great ideas on some of the simple steps we can take to live an effortlessly greener lifestyle.

The Dog Lover's Guide to Sustainable Living
https://www.rover.com/blog/dog-lovers-guide-sustainable-living/ 
We’re not the only ones who leave a carbon footprint – so do our furry friends. This article offers helpful advice on how you and your four-legged companion can both be more eco conscious.

The Impact of Your Grocery Store Choices
https://alumni.stanford.edu/get/page/magazine/article/?article_id=30150 
This article demonstrates how living a greener life often begins in the supermarket aisle.

Turn Your House Into a "Green" Energy Machine
http://www.mortgagecalculator.org/helpful-advice/green-homes.php 
Learn how to integrate renewable energy into your home to reduce your carbon footprint.

Thank you so much for spreading the word about this important topic. I know that together we can make a huge difference in the health of our planet, and therefore, ourselves!
 
I certainly hope that you and your site visitors find this information valuable, but if I’m wrong, please let me know. You can send me an e-mail and I will no longer contact you in my outreach efforts.
 
Best regards,
Sara
 
Sara Bell | s.bell@educatorlabs.org 
http://educatorlabs.org | Cultivating. Connecting. Curating.
2054 Kildaire Farm Rd. #204 | Cary, NC 27518

http://www2.epa.gov/recycle/recycling-basics 
http://www.conserve-energy-future.com/top-15-green-home-building-techniques-and-ideas.php

Patrick Otten

name: Brendan Lim
subject: Digester Manual
message:
To Whom It May Concern,

   My name is Brendan Lim and I work for Hello Fresh. My company uses one of your digester units for our daily operations. I am in the process of creating training materials for new employees and need information pertaining to operation of the digester. I understand performing maintenance on the machine requires turning off the power for safety reasons, but neither the operations manual available on your website nor the training videos explain how to do this safely without damaging the unit's hardware or software. Since my company's employees need to have this information, would there be a more detailed manual that can be e-mailed to me in PDF format?

name: Nishad
subject: Quotation for Food Recycler
message:
Dear Sir/Madam

One of our client looking for the below item for there food Lab. Kindly quote the price along with all acessories, trainning if applicable CIF Dubai basis.

Supply and installation of Food Wasting Recycling (Composting) Machine.

The machine should be able to compost food waste in 8 hours or less. Other requirements are listed 

below:

 Shall be not needed to segregate food before loading.

 May take 8hours or less to finish the whole composting process.

 It is not recommended to have the models which need to feed with microbes and adjust 

moisture content and frequent monitoring.

 The end product shall be biomass usable as soil enhancer and clean grey water that could 

be drained to the existing drainage facility directly.

 We shall be able to program it to automatic mode from start to finish.

 The machine shall have no air emissions, no odor, no noise emissions.

 May have inbuilt safety feature to shut off the machine once the door is opened and it can 

resume after closing the door.

Other requirements:

 Electricity: AC380V, 50Hz, 3 phase + Neutral + Earth, 5wire via 20ampere breaker. (The 

machine comes with a 5m length electrical cable and the breaker should be installed at a 

suitable place within this length).

 Drain hose required to the nearest drain point.

 Space requirement: 

- Size: 1400mm (L) x 950mm (D) x 1291mm (H) (at least 2 feet clearance from all sides 

- Weight: 600Kg

- Capacity: Per day 100Kg (2x cycles)

- Covered shaded area preferred)


Appreciate your immediate reply

name: Nishad
subject: Request for Quote
message:
The machine should be able to compost food waste in 8 hours or less. Other requirements are listed 
 
below:
 
§ Shall be not needed to segregate food before loading.
 
§ May take 8hours or less to finish the whole composting process.
 
§ It is not recommended to have the models which need to feed with microbes and adjust 
 
moisture content and frequent monitoring.
 
§ The end product shall be biomass usable as soil enhancer and clean grey water that could 
 
be drained to the existing drainage facility directly.
 
§ We shall be able to program it to automatic mode from start to finish.
 
§ The machine shall have no air emissions, no odor, no noise emissions.
 
§ May have inbuilt safety feature to shut off the machine once the door is opened and it can 
 
resume after closing the door.
 
Other requirements:
 
§ Electricity: AC380V, 50Hz, 3 phase + Neutral + Earth, 5wire via 20ampere breaker. (The 
 
machine comes with a 5m length electrical cable and the breaker should be installed at a 
 
suitable place within this length).
 
§ Drain hose required to the nearest drain point.
 
§ Space requirement: 
 
- Size: 1400mm (L) x 950mm (D) x 1291mm (H) (at least 2 feet clearance from all sides 
 
- Weight: 600Kg
 
- Capacity: Per day 100Kg (2x cycles)
 
- Covered shaded area preferred)

subject: DMT Clear Gas Solutions
message:
Dear Business Development Team,
Our company, DMT CGS is a pioneer in biogas/LFG cleaning with over 25 years of experience. We are based in Portland (OR, USA) and Montreal (QC, Canada) to serve our clients in USA and Canada. We have permanent business establishment and representatives in more than 15 countries. The biggest advantages of working with DMT CGS are: 

  Guarantee the performance of our technology with proven references (more than 30+) in several countries
  Highest uptime of the CNG plant (98%) ~ CNG availability. 
  Highest recovery of the methane (99,5%) from the biogas/LFG
  Local service and maintenance of our installation  
  Compact and containerized plug-play installation
  Start-up and production of CNG in 5 minutes; simple in operation (30 minutes monitoring onsite/week) 

DMT North America Highlights 2015

-      DMT is very pleased to share that we are contracted biogas upgrading project for a 2800 Nm3/h project in St. Louis, Missouri and also selected as a technology provider for 500 Nm3/h project in Montreal (QC) and 350 Nm3/h project in London (ON) to produce Renewable Natural Gas (RNG).
-      For your information, the other companies in biogas market have taken steps forward to develop membrane technology realizing that the membrane technology is the simplest in operation, highest uptime and highest methane recovery. We are way ahead on this front with our membrane technology and forming strategic partnership with big waste companies, good off-takers and financial partners who are assisting to close loops

Hello,

I am looking at digester solutions for a Singapore based hospitality company. We are looking for a large solution that can handle 10 TPD (metric) of food waste. Technical

    Can you let us know what the parameters of the effluent discharge is?

Financial
We would like to know:

    All CAPEX (i.e. unit cost, installation cost, any consultation fee) and
    OPEX costs for the unit (i.e. maintenance cost after warranty expire (per day of maintenance) how many days of planned maintenance per year, and unplanned maintenance per yer.
    Warranty for the unit (how long what does it cover, is their an option for renewal of the warranty and at what cost)

Thanks for your help,

Richard Belcher

name: Joss Hurford
subject: Technical Support
message:
I am looking into the unit for potential application in future kitchen refurbishments and would like to know more about its operation. Please could you provide me details of the following:

•	What does the electrical supply power in terms of internal components?
•	Are there any heating elements?
•	If there are heating elements or agitators, please could you provide details of the power draw and typical run time within a 24 hour cycle. 
•	What are the environmental conditions the unit should be placed in for good operation?
•	Does the unit emit heat to the surrounding space as part of the aerobic process? 
•	Is the unit insulated to prevent heat loss?
•	Are there any gases being vented? If so what are the exhaust requirements?
•	Are there any maintenance requirements to consider?

Thank you for your help.

Joss

Hello, my name is Brendan Kuhn, I am a recent MBA graduate from the University of Texas’ McCombs School of Business and am a native of Maryland, from just outside of Westminster.  As an MBA student I focused my coursework on clean tech and sustainability.  Prior to beginning my studies at the Univ. of Texas I developed an expertise in industrial operations management and engineering through my leadership in various roles and projects in the mining industry. In the past several years I have directly seen the environmental and financial opportunities presented by finding economic and efficient means of managing and eliminating our waste, an insight which was strengthened during my time working with Waste Management.  As such, I now seek opportunities to combine my expertise in industrial operations with my desire to improve and implement sustainable business operations.  I would greatly appreciate the opportunity to speak with you further regarding potential opportunities with BioHiTech.
Thank you.

Bryce Laguer

subject: Mercedes Bid quote-Need by tomorrow
message:
I am working on a bid DUE TOMORROW for an Eco-Safe 4. Please quote per spec. Job: Mercedes Benz Atlanta, Ga.

ITEM #92 DIGESTER
Quantity: Two (2)
Manufacturer: Custom
Model: ECO-SAFE 4
Furnish and set in place per manufacturer's standard specifications.
1. Eco-Safe 4 digester, handling capacity 800 lbs per day, 57”L x 44”D x 52”H.
2. Plumbing division to provide a mixing valve with connected 8 foot steel braided hose.
3. Thermometer incorporated into water line to visually monitory water temperature.
4. Garden hose attachment incorporated into water line with separate shut off valve, for use in
cleaning and serving the unit.
5. Two feet clearance required on all sides of the unit.
6. KEC to provide vibration isolation per manufacturer requirements and guidelines.
7. Eco-Safe-4 digester, handling capacity 800 lbs per day, 45.75”L x 35.5”D x 50”H.
8. Plumbing division to provide a mixing valve with connected 8 foot steel braided hose.
9. Thermometer incorporated into water line to visually monitory water temperature.
10. Garden hose attachment incorporated into water line with separate shut off valve, for use in
cleaning and serving the unit.
11. KEC to verify operational capacity with Owner prior to purchase.

Brazil Compostag

We are professionals in various activities, which due to the focus that the country has to drive the solid waste, we decided to unite our experiences to participate in the search for technological solutions that meet the most diverse forms of collection and treatment of household and business waste.
From the Federal Law 12,305 / 10, states and municipalities have taken steps, standardizing the collection and treatment services, so that from 2017 the law might be fulfilled in its entirety.
Brazil has a population of approximately 200 million inhabitants, distributed unevenly, with the state of São Paulo, where we stand, the most populous, with only 3% area ofBrazil concentrates 22% of the population, allowing us to initially act this location, which is the driving national business.
In reference our initial conversations and considering entry into force of Federal Law 12,305 / 10, and tax incentives for import of equipment for waste treatment, concluded the immediate need to disclose XXXXXX equipment in the Brazilian market, it is necessary to share our strategies deployment in two stages:

name: Lois Fegan
subject: Food Waste Diversion Options
message:
Hello! My name is Lois Fegan and I am the Sustainability Coordinator for the Virginia Department of Corrections.  We operate some compost units but are exploring other solutions for food waste.  Our major facilities throw away between 700 and 1000 pounds of food every day and it presents a great opportunity for diversion solutions.  We've piloted a food dehydrator system at a small correctional unit and saw great results...we used an EcoVim 250 unit from Integrated Veterans Services.  I am curious about your pricing and to learn more about your company.

Please feel free to contact me via email or phone anytime!

name: Stephanie Ingber
companyName: Student/ CUNY City College of New York
subject: Eco-Safe Digester Inquiry
message:
To whom it may concern,
I am a graduate student in an Urban Sustainability program and am currently working on my graduation project with a team (not to be published, purely experimental/research). To summarize, the project spotlights a neighborhood in Brooklyn where existing infrastructures have material links which could close waste loops, utilize local resources, and further benefit the surrounding community. 

My topic of research is in residential food waste, how it can be used as a resource, and the environmental benefits from keeping it out of landfills. The area of subject throws out about 3,000 pounds of food a day, does not have a mandatory organics recycling program, and only voluntarily composts(on an individual level), so there has to be a better way to make use of all this food waste.

Certain food waste disposal units seem convenient and clean, yet organic loading or insufficient sewer systems are real drawbacks. This is where I was especially intrigued with your product, the "Eco-Safe Digester", for every reason. The on-site aerobic digester, smart monitoring, and the type of effluent are distinctive qualities in this product. This digester seems like the perfect component for dealing with food waste, in the case of my project.

I have some questions about the "Eco-Safe Digester", concerning feasibility in this specific area, the type of effluent it produces and installation. Since I think this product is a perfect suggestion for reducing the neighborhood's food waste, I would like to get some more information about it.

Is it possible to set up a meeting or time to speak on the phone about the "Eco-Safe Digester"? If this is not possible, I will be more then happy to forward complete questions.

Your products are awesome and innovative. Thank you so much for taking this time to read my e-mail. I am looking forward to hearing back.

-Stephanie Ingber

name: Denis
message:
To whom it may concern,

Our company is a leader in reducing the amount of general mixed waste, to prevent its occurrence and to increase the level of waste sorting. We place an emphasis on the prevention of biodegradable waste disposal. Our solutions have had a positive impact on over 500,000 inhabitants and we are a partner to more than 450 villages and towns in the Czech Republic, Slovak Republic and Hungary. One of the most efficient ways of preventing organic waste disposal is the promotion of home composting. The next segment we are looking into is the kitchen waste. We are interested in your technology and we would like to set up a skype meeting where you could present your technology and hopefully we could test your product on some of our pilot project. We have already sold more than 230 fermentation device for treating the waste in an eco-friendly way. I would like to receive conditions and prices for your machines.

Please send me your availability. We can also get in contact by phone before we set up a skype meeting. I am looking forward to hear from you.

name: Brittany Bennett
subject: Junior Achievement Opportunities
message:
Hello,

I wanted to touch base with you quickly regarding today's Junior Achievement. 

If you are not familiar with Junior Achievement, JA is a non-profit organization who provides work readiness, entrepreneurship and financial literacy programs to area K-12 students free of charge. 

JA has developed one of our one-day volunteer program opportunities which might fit well with the culture of the BioHitech family.  ‘S.T.E.M. Summit’- a Science, Technology, Engineering and Math driven program targeted to area 9th and 10th grade students. This day consists of nine different stations each focusing on a different science. We like to describe this day as a loud fun messy engaging day filled with various experiments and competitions. This event is a wonderful opportunity to reach out into the community in which we work and live. We are currently in need of volunteers for Central Dauphin East High School on October 25th and 26th. 

The advent of our one-day volunteer formatting has made it incredibly easy for area business volunteers, such as yourself, to share their time and talents with area students. 

One day formats typically involve a time commitment between the hours of 8:00 am and 2:00 pm which still allows our business volunteers to return to their offices for the remainder of the day. We provide a lite breakfast, lunch and all support to make each volunteer’s day a success. 

We would be honored to welcome you and some of the BioHitech team, schedules permitting, to our JA family of volunteers. 

It would be my pleasure to stop by your office whenever your schedule would allow and give you a quick overview of some of the programs that Junior Achievement now provides to area K-12 students, free of charge. 

Please let me know what date and time work best for your schedule.

Looking forward to your reply and meeting you in person. 

Take care, 
Brittany

name: Steve Mangum
subject: Digesters and
message:
1.  Do you have referral or affiliate programs for resellers in Texas?
2.  What is cost?  How much money can we make off this tech?
3.  What system can handle 50 gallons a day of organics?
4.  Can this water feed plants?
5.  How do you compare to others (who is competition)?
6. Strengths and Weaknesses?
7. Where is distribution? 

My name is Steve Mangum, and I'm with a company in Dallas, TX called Zero Waste Advocacy.
We are creating the business model to make Zero Waste feasible for smaller businesses. We have clients that are interested in having digesters installed, and are comparing several brands. Would you  be willing to answer a few questions? 

1.  Do you have referral or affiliate programs for resellers in Texas?
2.  What is cost?  How much money can we make off this tech?
3.  What system can handle 50 gallons a day of organics?
4.  Can this water feed plants?
5.  How do you compare to others (who is competition)?
6. Strengths and Weaknesses?
7. Where is distribution? 
8. Can we drop-ship?
9. How easy to install and maintain?
10. Is it smart and Bluetooth or wifi enabled? 
11. What is the life expectancy?
12. Is there anything else that is important to know about digesters? 

Please respond by email first. If we need additional information, we will call you. (please provide your contact information).

Steve Mangum
Zero Waste Advocacy

name: Hadil Barghouti
subject: Inquiry from Jordan
message:
Dear Sirs,

First allow me to introduce myself, my name is Hadil Barghouti, I’m the Business Development Director at ADR Imagine Group. ADR specializes in the manufacturing and modification of superstructure vehicles and is the sole distributor of Carrier Truck, Trailer, and Container Refrigeration Solutions in Jordan.

As part of its 2017 business development plan, ADR is looking to explore a completely new line of business. Given the new and dynamic demographics in Jordan, partly due to the influx of refugees along with other political and social factors, overfilled and rather neglected landfills are becoming one of the main challenges for policy makers.

However, we as ADR saw this as an opportunity rather than a setback.  
So we decided to step up and be part of the solution.

With that being said, please note that we are in the process of establishing a composting facility in Jordan to produce high-quality fertilizer purely derived from food waste. When operational, it will be the first community-based composting facility in the country. Our vision is not only to produce and sell compost, but rather to start a revolutionary awareness campaign aimed at educating people from every walk of life about the overlooked environmental risks of their wasteful habits and enlightening them on how they can become responsible citizens.

Thus, we are very interested in learning more about your company and your products, so as to go further.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best,

Hadil Barghouti
Business Development Director
ADR Imagine Group
+96279-6000-414
Amman, Jordan

name: Kartik Pandya
subject: Food waste management system.
message:
First of all,  I would like to congratulate your entire team, for developing such good idea and equipment. I've been looking for such equipments for a long. World needs such innovative ideas to to keep it green and clean. India is one of the fastest growing markets in the world and every single day, it ads up to the increasing food waste. With increasing infrastructure economy and growth, the food waste management becomes more complex and generally no one is bothered about it and the entire waste is either dumped on plain grounds or into the sea. 
 
    Now coming to the point, we are equipment manufacturers and are serving pharma, chemical, engineering etc. industries since 1986. Recently with the growing demand of food processing and enhanced value addition process in Agri products, we have developed specialised equipments related to food processing (mainly in Dehyderation, drying process). In the process we are setting up a dedicated stream which will be exclusively working on major & minor food projects. We are looking forward to incorporate food waste management systems and related products in our product list. With our experience and long term presence in the field, we expect a very good business opportunity along with a social responsibility. 
 I've had a detailed look at the process you displayed on your web. And must say it is a fantastic method and creates a win win situation for all.

 Our new Government has pledged to make India greener and cleaner. The Swatch Bharat Abhiyan. We sense a good opportunity to work under the scheme. With reformed rules and better business environment the govt. is working hard on provision of better opportunities to home as well as foreign companies to work in India. And with both our governments coming closer than ever before, we wish to establish a good and strong people to people engagement as well.

  Along with serving the industry, we also wish to marginalise the process to house holds and on micro levels as well as village & town level. 

 I would like to know, if your esteemed organisation is interested to work with us and be a part of our drive to provide one step solution to existing as well as up coming projects. 

   Looking forward to hear from you.
 

Thanking You,

Truly Your's,

For Industrial Fabricators,

Kartik Pandya
(Manager Purchase/Sales & Business Development)
+919998540492
www.dryersindia.com

name: Neetu Garcha
subject: Exhibitor Opportunity: Canada's 2017 Food Loss + Waste Forum
message:
Hello,

I am reaching out to you with an exciting opportunity to exhibit at our annual industry event.

Provision Coalition with its collaborative partners: National Zero Waste Council and PAC, Packaging Consortium, presents Canada's 2017 Food Loss + Waste Forum | Finding Solutions at the Mississauga Convention Centre in Mississauga, Ontario on April 12, 2017.  We believe this would be a great opportunity for you to showcase your solutions to the food loss and waste problem. I can send you the exhibitor prospectus per your request.

Our premier event will bring together leaders in food loss + waste from across Canada's food value chain. We are expecting 150-200 attendees who will hear from local and global experts and industry through keynotes, plenary sessions, panel discussions and exhibitor solutions showcase. This full-day event focuses on sharing opportunities and demonstrating pragmatic solutions, best practices, and innovative technologies that are readily available in the marketplace to address the food waste challenge.  Additional information, including the draft agenda, can be found on our event page: http://www.provisioncoalition.com/newsevents/foodlosswasteforum 

Based on the high-profile nature of food waste, this forum will attract media, producers, manufacturers, retailers, distributors, food service, agri-food industry associations, policy and decision-makers, solutions providers, technology developers and vendors, subject matter experts, academia, not-for-profits and other stakeholders. This is an excellent opportunity for your organization to extend its reach and build profile with value chain stakeholders across the food and beverage industry.  

Confirmed Speakers Include:
•	Kai Robertson, Lead Advisor, World Resources Institute (WRI)
•	David Donaldson, Commission for Environmental Cooperation (CEC)
•	Andrew Shakman, CEO & Co-Founder, LeanPath
•	Jonathan Bloom, MC
•	Bob Long, Federation of Canadian Municipalities (FCM) Board Director, National Zero Waste Council Board Member, and Co-chair of the Food Working Group
•	Eva Goulbourne, Associate Director, Programs and Communications, ReFED
•	Dr. Deb Stark, Ex-Deputy Minister, OMAFRA
•	Doug Alexander, Director of Engineering, Ippolito Fruit and Produce 

If this event seems of interest to you, can we arrange a date and time to discuss this opportunity further?

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me.

Thanks,
Neetu

We are reaching out to to see if you'd like to participate in contributing to our foundation.  Joey's Fund was born to honor and keep alive the memory of Joey DeCarlo, who passed away from Leukemia at the age of 2.  We are a foundation that is committed to assisting the families of St. Joseph's Children's Hospital who have a child suffering from a life threatening illness.   

The DeCarlo family first hand witnessed the emotional strain first and foremost, but also the financial burden families endure while their children are undergoing treatments.   We are dedicated to providing emotional and financial support to these families during their time of need, and we are asking you to help us pay it forward! We will be hosting our Third Annual Charity Car Show in September of 2017 and we are seeking your interest in helping to make this charity event a great success!  We are a small but mighty organization, and during our very first two years, we were able to raise a significant amount of money for the patients and families of St. Joseph's Children's Hospital, and moreover, spread awareness of our mission. 

To learn more, please visit our website and feel free to reach out to me with any questions! We look forward to the opportunity of working with you and hope to hear back from you very soon.

Chelsea

name: Marc Escamilla
subject: Technology to convert organic waste into syngas
message:
Dear Sir/Madam,

I am writing you on behalf of the Spanish National Research Council (CSIC), to talk about a new process that has been developed in our laboratories.

The process consists in a treatment method to convert organic and cellulosic waste into syngas using microwaves. It can convert more than 50 %w of input into high purity syngas (mostly CO and H2), and avoids the production of pyrolysis oils which results in an increased efficiency. The resulting pyrolyzed can be used as input because it is a good microwave susceptor, and probably could be used as soil amendment too. The energy balance of the process is next to zero if we take into consideration the energy confined into the gas.

We are looking for a commercial partner who could upscale and commercialize the device.

I will appreciate if you could make this information arrive to your R+D manager or to your CEO. And in case you need further information or you want to make any comment please don’t hesitate in contacting me, I will be pleased to attend your inquiries.

Kind regards,

Mr. Marc Escamilla
Technology transfer technician

name: Janosikova Eva
subject: Eco-Safe Digester
message:
Dear Sir or Madam,

I am writing you to propose cooperation, which includes promoting your product Eco-Safe Digester to Slovak or  Czech markets and acquiring new customers for your product in this region.

The conditions for the successful application of your product in our market are few:

•the commitment of the Slovak Republic - by 2020 to reduce the amount of biodegradable municipal waste (it also includes a kitchen and canteen waste) going to landfills to 35% of the total amount produced in 1995 (in accordance with Council Directive 1999/31 / EC on the landfill of waste) and 


•as stated in the Waste Management Programme of the Slovak Republic for 2016 – 2020,  the  system for collecting kitchen and canteen waste is insufficient and unsatisfactory and will be one of the priorities of waste management supported under the EU Operational Programme Environment Quality. 

The fact remains, that for the years 2010, 2013 and 2020 were set quantity of the biodegradable municipal waste going to landfill and the target for the 2013 was not achieved; in 2013 was put about 17% more biodegradable municipal waste to landfill.


I am currently employed by the MOF as the methodist in the regulation of the budget process, in private, however, along with my husband devote organic farming (ie. including the use of effective microorganisms of the Multikraft). I have took notice of your product 2 years ago and  I believe in the future of  this product as  the valuable alternative to composting and a biogas plant. I think  that the idea about promoting this product in the Slovak/Czech market  has become  more realistic  after establishing  BioHiTech  Europe LTD.

In addition to my internal motivation, I can offer my general knowledge and orientation in the regulatory rules, previous work experience in the financial activity of the business company  and the contacts for enviromentally oriented Civic Associations.

 I am looking forward to hearing your perspective on our potential cooperation.


Eva Janosikova

janosikova.e@gmail.com

Vistuk 94
900 85 Vistuk
Slovak Republic
Europe

subject: Business Opportunity Dominican Republic
message:
Hello,

I was really intrigued by your food digester machines and believe that they can have a real impact here in the Dominican Republic. I was hoping that we could reach an agreement to represent the BioHiTech brand here.

As a brief introduction to Rosente, we are a group of well connected individuals who dedicate our skills and resources to consulting and developing socially responsible business with the intention of positively impacting society and modern business. We have a number of diverse backgrounds ranging anywhere from renewable energies, to pharmaceuticals, to agriculture. 

We believe that the food digester might have a positive impact here because currently solutions for food waste are very limited here. This is also an opportunity for BioHiTech to expand to new markets and continue growing consciousness to better our world. 

Please contact me at salman@rosente.com to get in touch so we can get better acquainted and see where this might lead. Looking forward to hearing back from you!

Best,
Salman Brache

message:
Dear Entrepreneur,
Greeting and wishing you a great business day!
If your website is outdated or finds it hard to stand out from rest of the competition, an update is highly recommended. Web design can determine whether or not your business will be able to generate profitable opportunities. New well-designed and mobile responsive websites have the ability to increase traffic along with the input of an enhanced user interface that will help to generate new business.
Our Key Success Factors for your Website Design & Development:
•	Impressive and worthy of catching the attention of your clients and perspective customers.
•	Well displayed with proper navigation links and frameworks in place.
•	Appealing to the eye with good aesthetics, color schemes, fonts and graphics.
•	Capable of high speed loading.
•	Is Google friendly and can be easily searched with well planned optimization tools and applications.
•	Presents wide brand knowledge of your products and services.
•	Designs which are affordable and of high quality.
•	Development standards and logo designs which have an international appeal.
•	Website designs to suit the customized needs of various verticals globally.
•	Relevant content and design to bring improvements in traffic, brand awareness, loyalty and revenues.

name: Ronald Tenerowicz
subject: A Message From BioHiTech
message:
Hi There, 

Our company creates custom engaging animated business videos for businesses like yours to help increase your online exposures. 

Animated business videos help companies explain their products or services more efficiently to potential customers. 

Potential customers engage more when there’s a video presentation, most of us would rather watch a video that explains a product or a service than to read the content of a website to know what the offer is. 

Would you be interested in having an animated business video for your company to help increase your online exposure? 

If you’re interested, please reply back to this message and I will send you some of our animated video samples to see what we can do to help your business grow this year.

name: Jennifer McGregor
subject: How we can make small changes to combat climate change
message:
Hi there,

Now that I’m in med school, I’m more aware than ever of my health, and one of the best things I’ve ever done for my overall health is becoming a vegetarian. And although this was initially a change I made for my own well-being, the more research I do, the more I realize it’s also good for the planet.

It’s really important that we all do what we can to halt or even reverse the effects of climate change, and eating a plant-based (or even mostly plant-based) diet is one of many things we can all do to make a significant impact. The health of our planet has really become an important topic to me lately, and since I know not everyone is interested in giving up meat, I’m doing what I can to shed light on some of the actions we can all take to live a greener life.

As part of those efforts, I’m sending you some fantastic articles that I hope you’ll consider adding somewhere on your site so your readers can take a look at them. Would you be able to add the resources below to this page, or maybe somewhere similar: http://www.biohitech.com/blog?

Thanks in advance for sharing! Also, I’d love to write something unique for you to share on your site, if you’re interested. Just let me know what you think.

Eat More Plants to Improve Health, Combat Climate Change
https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/eat-more-plants-to-improve-health-combat-climate-change/

Infographic: We all want to help the planet. But how?
http://www.chooseveg.com/environment

15 Tips to Make Your Home More Green
https://www.redfin.com/blog/2014/04/15-tips-to-make-your-home-more-green.html

The Top Green Home Building Techniques
http://www.conserve-energy-future.com/top-15-green-home-building-techniques-and-ideas.php

The Green Guide to Downsizing: How to Modify Your Home for More Eco-Conscious Living
https://www.closetbox.com/resources/green-guide-downsizing/

Incorporating ‘Green’ Into Your Business Practices
http://www.triplepundit.com/2014/10/goals-objectives-incorporating-green-business-practices/

Culinary Resources for Vegetarianism
http://www.culinaryschools.org/cooking-school-types/vegetarian/resources.php

5 Steps To Become An Eco-Friendly Pet Parent
https://petcube.com/blog/5-steps-eco-friendly-pet-parent/

Thanks!
Jennifer

Jennifer McGregor, jennifer@publichealthlibrary.org

If you would prefer I didn’t reach out in the future, please send me an email letting me know.

name: Jason Survilas
subject: Code compliment?
message:
Are digesters Massachusetts plumbing board approved?  I don't see them listed.

Regulation are in place in part to keep large quantity producers from putting food waste in landfills as well as taxing the municipal sanitary system.  
Are digesters approved by the Massachusetts Water resources Authority?

What PH is the discharge to sanitary at?  What is the water content of the discharge?
Will the discharge congeal or coat sanitary drain piping?  Is there a recommendation on the discharge mix with regular building sanitary as quick as possible to prevent the discharge from sitting in pipe?  What distance if any is recommended.
What are the risks to the digestion process?  Do you recommend a standby system?

name: Alejandro Chambi Buscaglia
subject: Large restaurants for up to 8000 clients daily
message:
Hi,
Good morning,

Let me present my self I am the Environmental Superintendent of a large Copper Mining Producer. Currently we have around 8,000 employees in the area distributed in 4 camps. The kitchen and lunch areas serves 3 meals a day for each employee generating around 1860kg/day of organics between the kitchen and lunch area of the smaller camp of 550 inhabitants. I calculated a figure around 23 tons per day of organic food. Currently we sent it to the Landfill, so your solution could solve and enlarge landfill life and cut cost as the Landfill is located around 60km away and transportation cost are large.

As you understand I need to make a business case to support any decision, so I need some answer to figure it out the NPV (net present value)

Which solution could you offer us ?
which is the capital cost to invest?
Which are the running cost - operational cost? including spare parts 
Which is the life time of each digestor?
Which are the residuals of the digestor?
the residual need any treatment?
which is the physical space required for each digestor?
How much energy it consumes?
Which supplies it requires per kg? and how much does it cost.

We also produce large amount of paper and cardboard. do you have any solution for these?

Alejandro Chambi Buscaglia | Environmental Superintendent Mine & Process Plant
+507  380-5836  Ext. # 5494|  +507 661.977.10| 
Alejandro.Chambi@fqml.com

name: mustafa nevres
subject: partnership
message:
Dear Sir/Madam

Shortly i  want to introduce me and my company to you.

I have my own company for more than 15 years.I am manufacturing cutlery polisher machines and my customers are mostly hotels, restaurants, staff canteens, militaries, colleges, universities and all of the eateries.

I have more than 1000 customers in Turkey and i also have export business to UK, Australia, Belgium, Holland, Bulgaria and some of Europan countries.
I always look for new products which i can supply to my existing and/or non-existing ( potential ) customers..And i am thinking that if i find new product, it must be completely new, or non-existed before in Turkish market.

I know that there are many company which manufactures garbage disposer..But all of them remains residue..So most of them are similar wiith each others.
I have checked you website and see that there is no food residue after process in your units.This is very good news for Turkish market..

Altough i saw on your website, i want to know below to be sure :

* Are there any waste residue after the unit ?
* Will the foodwaste which we put into machine, completely happen water and then go to internal drainage ?
* Is anything else , does to facility need to buy ( consumption material ? )

name: Luis Carlos Balma
subject: BioHighTech for Costa Rica
message:
Hello BioHighTech,

I am an entrepreneur based in Costa Rica, seeking for opportunities to make an impact in the environment, through initiatives that can reduce the amount of waste going to landfills, and turn “trash” into something useful. In that sense, I find your company to be an interesting match.

I have been evaluating the Costa Rican market, and I see a lot of potential for this kind of solutions, due to the recent government regulations regarding the handling and disposal of waste and a traditionally environmentally friendly approach.

I have a very high interest in partnering as a distributor or re-seller of your company, and generating a big IMPACT in this part of the world.

I would like to have a better understanding of your solutions and the possibilities of being your extended sales arm in Central America.

To understand better the Digester machine, I have some questions:


As I understand, the Digester doesn't produce a final product like biomass or fertilizer? It only discharged wastewater, right?
Does the wastewater is safe for the sewerage?
As I read the PDF, the Digester consumes a high number of gallons of water per day, does the discharged wastewater can be use in the machine?

Please let me know your thoughts.

Kind regards,
Luis Carlos Balma.

name: Chris Sprague
subject: Digester
message:
Dear BioHiTech:  I am a member of the Recycling Advisory Committee (the "RAC") for the City of Summit, NJ, and I am writing to you on behalf of the RAC.  The RAC is researching equipment that Summit could purchase, to be used to recycle food waste.  This equipment would be situated at our Transfer Station (where things like garbage, yard clippings, and other items are taken).  At this phase we are unsure of the intended scope of the program, and whether it would be available to residential, business and commercial sectors, or only some combination of the three. 



Below are some basic initial questions that we have for your company.  If possible, it would be best if we received written answers, and then it might be best to schedule a follow-up call to further discuss.  If you are unable to address these questions, can you identify someone who would be able to do so? 

Many thanks for your continued assistance.

Chris Sprague



Here are our initial questions, with respect to your Digesters.  Please respond to the following questions, and let me know if you need additional information to answer these questions.  





- How long has your Digester been commercially available?

- What is the life expectancy of the Digester?

- Does your Company offer a formal sales presentation/pitch for the Digester? If so, can we schedule one?

- Can you identify several locations that utilize your Digester?  (including other municipalities), and can you provide contact information for representatives at such sites for us to speak with?

- Can we schedule a tour of a facility that utilizes your Digester?

- Can you identify competitors of BioHiTech?

- Could your Company offer suggestions for sizing the appropriate type of equipment, given our City’s particulars? What data would your Company require from us in order to provide sizing guidance for residential, businesses, and commercial needs (or some combination thereof)? Basically, we need assistance in estimating food scrap generation, other than an audit. 

- If an oversized Digester is purchased, the thinking being that the City would grow into it, is the effectiveness of the  compromised?

- What are the housing requirements for your Digester? (indoor insulation/heat, electricity, water, etc.) Basically, what are the general start-up requirements. 

- What are the maintenance needs and concerns? 

- Have there been any repeated maintenance or other problems that your Company is aware of? 

- What is the environmental impact on the sewage system?

- Are there concerns with respect to noise, odor, pests, or otherwise, that we should take into consideration?

- Are there regulatory or permitting concerns that we should take into consideration?

message:
My name is Amanda Maxon. I am a Biotechnology student at American University currently taking ICorps. I am writing to you to enquire some information about obtaining some information about Biogas production farming using organic waste for a class project.

The project will focus on the development and design of biogas production from small scale farming and agriculture waste. My group chose the biogas waste management sector beacuse of its potential as a source of energy using organic waste from animals to produce energy and valuable soil products such as manure and fertilizers. We are trying to find more information about confined animal manure and management practices. 

Would you be wiling to answer some questions about our design by in person, Skype, phone, or email sometime next week? This discussion will take approximately be 30 minutes. We are hope with your cooperation that we will give a good representation of the biogas industry and its needs for innovation and development.

Email: am0804a@student.american.edu  
 
Thank you for your time.
 
Thank You
Amanda S Maxon

name: Scott Bradshaw
subject: Waste Recovery Partnership.
message:
Mr. Frank Celli, 
I am a 25-year veteran of the waste and recycling business and like BioHTech, I desire to help change the historic waste management model.  I have been exploring sustainable waste management/recovery companies and find that BioHiTech is of interest and appears to have a very promising future. 
A public MSW landfill, nearing full capacity, and collection company may soon be privatized via a public bid. My vision is to provide a proposal to purchase the landfill and collection company, purchase other waste collection companies located in the waste shed and partner with a company like BioHiTech whereby I would provide the feedstock for a biomass facility with the SRF to be sold to a local power plant. The feedstock could also include MSW from the existing landfill (only 600 lbs/cubic yard in-situ density) which would create new landfill capacity for the residual waste from the recovery facility located at or near the subject landfill.  
If this is of interest, I would appreciate discussing this more with your company. 

Sincerely, 
Scott Bradshaw
281-512-1549.

name: Subrat Mishra
subject: Suggestion for your website
message:
Hello,
 
I represent SEOFIED - An Indian Search Engine Optimization and web design company offering SEO, Social Media Optimization, Web & ecommerce Design & Development Solutions.
 
Analyzing a website critical issues, takes a considerable amount of time and I can produce a Free report showing the overall SEO Issues of your website, once you reply showing interest on our work process. 
 
Here is what we offer in terms of maintaining and improving your online traffic, sales and overall internet presence….
 
1) The first thing we will do is to compose a list up to 2 closest competitor websites that are well placed in search engine rankings.
 
2) We will then set Google alerts for news and updates coming from these websites on a daily basis and create links based on them.
 
3)We will download all the back links from your competitors one by one and create back links for your website.
 
4)We will keep constant vigilance on these 2 Competitors...their work plans, marketing mix, online sales strategy, how they are maintaining their website and how much they investing in marketing their website per month.
 
5)All reports will be dispatched weekly based on “Competitor analysis and reviews from our technical team”.
 
6)We will check your site for “canonical” issues (Duplicate Content & Url Issues) and also rewrite your “Meta Titles”…Meta Descriptions” and “Meta Keywords” and implement the changes on the site. 
 
7) We will improve your site visits by changing and improving your on page and off page SEO Factors.
 
8) We will analyze your sitemap to make sure it is correct and submit to GWT (Google Webmaster Tools).
 
9) We will also check to make sure your website’s navigational structure and internal links looks SEO friendly. 
 
10) We will add Internal Blog within your site and produce content describing your product & services.
 
11) All your pages will be checked to make sure your site has the correct keyword density, very important for search engines.
 
12) We will check to make sure your content and design meets the guidelines as set out in Google Webmaster Tool.
 
13) We will do “off page” Link building on the following theme: Directory, Bookmark, Articles, Blogs, comments, forums etc in order to increase the back links and to rank your website in the top tier of search engines.
 
14) All Business listing websites will be emailed to you for review before we get started working on them.
 
15)  A report will be emailed to you each week as a “Weekly report” where you find all work completed each week.
 
16) We have dedicated managers to check and respond to your emails (usually with an hour) to resolve any issues, suggestions or questions you may have.
 
17) We will be pleased to guide and explain you the search engine guidelines and help you understand how to manage your website smoothly and effectively.
 
I am sure a SEO & SMO (Social Media Optimization) service offerings from SEOFIED will boost your website site visits which is the Ultimate goal of every website owner. Do let me Know if SEOFIED can be a preferred vendor for you, supporting your SEO goal.
 
If you are looking the same please Send us by email the list of keywords (or) search terms on which you would like to optimize your website, otherwise our SEO Support team will propose keywords after a thorough review of your website.
 
Contact us at your convenience and provide a phone number or Skype ID that you would like us to call and discuss your requirements. 
 
Thank you for your time…


Thanks & Regards
Subrat

name: james ponder
subject: A new approach
message:
I was struck by the 2nd qtr earnings conference call in which management was congratulated by analysts for having a great quarter ----followed by  their seemingly universal disdain (post call) over the company's typical increase in revenues with corollary decrease in bottom line earnings. But after all, this is our company's historical norm.

What mostly worried me was the news after the call that we could expect an additional 7 million in revenue in 2019. Following our historical norm this may result in driving our earnings loss per qtr to be over $2. 

I have devised a ploy that may help our PR. We announce the formation of a seperate but secret division called project X. Over the next few months we truthfully announce that project X revenues AND positive earnings are increasing at an annual rate 100% per month. Eventually we'll have to announce that Project X has been terminated. What we never tell them is that the business model of Project X was that of a series of sidewalk lemonade stands (summer) or Hot chocolate (winter).

But I'm sticking with you guys as one hell of a loyal stockholder. I'm sure that in 10 or 20 years I will be glad that I did.   P.S. There is nothing of consequence for you to answer to in my idiotic ramblings here.

name: Pat Marcelo
subject: INTERESTED TO JOIN AND PARTNER WITH YOU IN WTE PROJECTS
message:
Gentlemen:

Our company, Mardee Solar Power Corporation, is a power generation company here in the Philippines, established in 2017, as start-up company. At present, conducting research by implementing an anaerobic digestion waste-to-energy power plant, now pending for issuance Service Contract with the Department of Energy (DOE).

But before going farther, let me say something how we venture in this project. In 2008, the proponent conceptualize the project, at first, called this concept as recycling and "electricity generation" plant project, and since then I have promoted it till this writing. To make the story short, in 2016 our company engaged in a 10MW Solar Power Plant owned by Mardee, and secured sovereign guarantee from PhilExim (now PHILGUARANTEE) for the solar power project, but the Feed-in-tariff (FIT) was suspende in March 2016, reasons diverted to my pet wte pet project.

For now, since waste-to-energy is among our main objectives provided in our corporation purposes and objectives, and timely to implement, after 30 days stay and traveled the United States in June this year, with the invitation of a would be partner in this ambitious WtE project,  armed with PhilExim Php 3.5 billion (US$70 million) sovereign guarantee in the hope that my partner owns a power plant, to my dismay what he shows me is the Grand Central Recycling Center at City of Industry, California, owned and managed by Van Dyke Recycling Corp., a partner appeared an agent of Van Dyke recycling equipment.

But so much for that, for and in behalf of the corporation, since this
Waste-to-Energy project is on the go, and submitted Letter of Intent with DOE, and the availability of the project funds are now in place, it is now our company obligations to implement the same once we submit the complete 2,000 - 4,000 tpd,15 MW Anaerobic Digestion from Municipal Solid Waste (MSW) Waste-to-Energy Project, reasons on our part to look for a membership to your prestigious organization, and if possible partner with your members company in this endeavor.

Looking forward a positive response from your end.

Thank you so much.

Pat Marcelo
President
Mardee Renewable Energy Developer Corp.
Room 1 PhilExcel Admin Bldg.
M.A Roxas Avenue, Clarkfield
Pampanga
Moblile Nos: +639394591980 / +639995930330
